conclusion: Analyze motion of blocks using energy and momentum conservation
Block A starts from rest at height h, potential energy converts to kinetic energy
Calculate speed of block A: v_A = sqrt(2gh)
Apply conservation of momentum during collision, blocks stick together
Calculate common velocity after collision: v_AB = v_A / 3
Calculate kinetic energy of block A before collision: KE_before = mgh
Calculate kinetic energy of combined blocks after collision: KE_after = (1/3)mgh
Determine heat generated during collision: Q = (2/3)mgh
